intro: Lasianthus africanus subsp. africanus, commonly known as the African flame bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of bright red flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and glossy, providing a striking contrast to the vibrant floral display. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
